page.title: 16CASTLETOWN JANITOR'S DAY
page.content: Every morning at 07.00 Mr.MacLeod rises .After a breakfast of porridge he goes to school in his car.First he switches on the boilers,next he unlocks the classroom doors,and at 09.00 the children's doors are unlocked.If the weather is bad these doors are opened earlier.Each day Mr.MacLeod sweeps the corridors and tidies up.At 12.15 he has a light lunch which may be a pie or eggs.In the afternoon he goes to the Post Office to collect mail.Then he washes the toilets and sweeps up .After the pupils go home he supervises the cleaners.At 17.00 he has a three course dinner.In very cold weather Mr.MacLeod may have to turn the boilers on at night.In summer he cuts grass,trims edges and marks lines for football and sports.The school is given a thorough clean during holidays
